text: Granite Peak-Northwest Peak () is in the Beartooth Mountains in the U.S. state of Montana. Granite Peak-Northwest Peak is also known as Peak 12745, and is only northwest of Granite Peak, the tallest mountain in Montana. With just over of topographic prominence, Granite Peak-Northwest Peak may be considered a distinct peak from Granite Peak, or merely a lower subpeak due to being part of the same massif. If considered a distinct peak, it is the second tallest mountain in Montana. Granite Peak-Northwest Peak is in the Absaroka-Beartooth Wilderness on the border of Custer and Gallatin National Forests. ==References== Granite Peak-Northwest Peak Category:Beartooth Mountains Category:Mountains of Park County, Montana
title: Granite Peak-Northwest Peak
